text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale. On this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm going to show

you how to make a White Chicken Chili. It's
such a great recipe, love one pot wonders

like this. It can just pretty much take care
of itself and then you've got an amazing dinner

at the end of it. Now let me take you over
the ingredients so we can get started. You're

going to need some ground chicken. This is
some Italian turkey sausage with the casings

removed. Some cannellini beans that have been
drained and rinsed. Chopped onion, garlic,

a mixture of chili powder, You are going to
need some oregano, ground cumin. These are

some canned mild chilies. Some chicken stock,
some salt and pepper. A little bit of olive

oil and just a couple of additional ingredients
are going to come at the end of it. But for

now, we really need to get right into the
cooking. Now I have got a big pot here with

a couple of tablespoons of olive oil Preheating
over about medium-high heat. I want this to

be nice and hot so let me test it. Oh yeah.
I'm going to add in my chicken, along with

my turkey sausage. And I'm going to break
this up into small pieces, or small as I can

manage anyway. I'm going to let this cook
until it's mostly cooked through. I will show

you what it looks like once it's there. To
my chicken mixture, I'm going to add in my

chopped onion. And I want to season this with
just a little bit of salt and pepper. I want

to season every layer of the dish. I'm going
to let this mixture cook for about ten minutes.

I want the onions to really start to cook
down a bit and develop some color. And once

it's there, I will show you the next step.
After about ten minutes, my chicken and onions

are great. Smells great, they have developed
a lot of really great color. I'm going to

add in my spices and my garlic. I'm going
to let this cook for about thirty minutes,

constantly stirring because I don't want the
spices to burn. So just cook them for about

thirty seconds. I just said thirty minutes,
but obviously I meant thirty seconds. My little

brain isn't working so well today for some
reason. I've got too many things on my mind

and one of them is going to be eating this
chili. It's all I can think about because

it smells so amazing. Now, in here I'm going
to add in my chicken stock, along with my

chilies. These are mild, canned chilies and
my cannellini beans. I have to tell you, I

am a huge fan of regular ground beef chili.
And I have a recipe in Laurainthekitchen.com

for it. I really love it. I think it's amazing.
But I have to tell you, you've got to try

this recipe because it's slightly different,
yet still has the depth of flavors of a traditional

chili. It's delicious and you really should
try it. And I really also love a nice chili

con-carne which for me a chili con-carne is
a chili with like an actual piece of rump

roast or something which has been cooked for
hours and then pulled apart and served over

rice or something. I love chili. What is your
favorite kind of chili is what I want to know.

Because if I haven't made it already, then
I want to. So let me know in the comments

down below what your favorite is, and you
will be seeing it soon here on Laura in the

Kitchen. Now this is going to come up to a
boil. I'm going to partially cover it, turn

it down to low and then I'm going to let it
cook for two and a half hours and I will show

you what it looks like once it's there. My
chili has been cooking for about two and a

half hours. It is perfection on every level.
Smells amazing. I'm going to add a touch of

cream to this and trust me when I tell you,
this makes it from delicious to outstanding.

It gives it a really nice richness and really
balances the chili powder well and the canned

chilies we have put in there. Tones them down
a little bit but highlights them so it's like

I can eat it and I can taste the chilies,
but I'm not overpowered by them. We didn't

put any tomato products to balance it like
we would in a regular chili. So a little bit

of cream does the job. Now I'm also going
to add in some fresh cilantro and I'm going

to season this with salt and pepper. Give
this a try and I think it needs a bit more

seasoning. But at this point it is completely
up to you. You just want to check on it and

just taste it and if you think it needs a
bit more, then you add a bit more. It's all

to taste. So let's just give this a stir.
Turn this off. Done. We're done. Smell's so

good and you could serve this as is, with
some rice, with some corn bread, you could

top it with some sour cream and maybe a little
bit of cheddar. I'm just saying. You could

if you wanted to. But I'm going to eat it
as is. I think it's rich enough and I think

it's just going to be delicious without anything
else on top of it. Or you can even put some

guacamole on top of it. Or some fresh salsa.
I'm getting ahead of myself here. I just need

to get down to tasting. It's going to be a
little hot. That is a home run. So delicious

and so incredibly easy to put together. I'm
going back in for more. If you want to get

this recipe, you know where to find it. Laurainthekitchen.com
has got you covered. I'll see you next time.
Bye.
